title: The Product Rule for Simplifying Square Roots
text: If a and $$b$$ are nonnegative, the square root of the product ab is equal to the product of the square roots of a and b: $$\sqrt{a b}=\sqrt{a} \sqrt{b}$$
speech: If a and  b  are nonnegative, the square root of the product ab is equal to the product of the square roots of a and b: , the square root of a b end root is equal to, the square root of a the square root of b

title: The Product Rule for Simplifying Square Roots
text: Use the product rule to simplify the expression: $$\sqrt{12} \sqrt{3}=\sqrt{12\times3}=\sqrt{36}$$
speech: Use the product rule to simplify the expression:  the square root of 12 the square root of 3 is equal to, the square root of 12 times 3 end root is equal to, the square root of 36

title: Principal Square Root
text: The principal square root of a is the nonnegative number that, when multiplied by itself, equals a. It is written as a radical expression, with a symbol called a radical over the term called the radicand: $$\sqrt{a}$$.
speech: The principal square root of a is the nonnegative number that, when multiplied by itself, equals a. It is written as a radical expression, with a symbol called a radical over the term called the radicand:  the square root of a .

title: Principal Square Root
text: What number multiplied by itself equals 36?
